FuncDef:
The port-type command sets an interface type.
The undo port-type command deletes the setting of an interface type.
By default, a device determines the interface type according to the type of the Small Form-Factor Pluggable (SFP) module.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the interface type to 100M optical.
-

Sets the interface type to 1000M optical.
-

Sets the interface type to electrical.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a fixed interface type for a GE interface, run the port-type command.
If an SFP interface that cannot be identified works properly, you can forcibly configure an interface type for the SFP interface by using the port-type command.
Prerequisites
The interface where the port-type command is to be run is an adaptive GE interface.
Configuration Impact
After you run the port-type command, the configurations of an interface, including the loopback mode, speed, negotiation and duplex mode, are restored to default settings. You need to configure the interface again.
When you replace the SFP module, the configurations of an interface, including the loopback mode, speed, negotiation and duplex mode, are restored to default settings. You need to configure the interface again.
Precautions
When an interface has a 100M optical module installed, you are not allowed to configure the port-type fiber-1000 command.
You can transform an optical interface into an electrical interface by configuring the keyword copper when the following conditions are met:
The rate of the optical interface must not be less than 1000 Mbit/s.The SFP module that can transform an optical interface into an electrical interface must be available.
